article.title: The role of cooperation in spatially explicit economical systems

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main conjecture about the basic model in econophysics discussed in the introduction?
choices: Money is always distributed evenly among agents.
The limiting distribution of money resembles a normal distribution.
The distribution of money can be approximated by an exponential distribution with parameter related to average money per agent.
Money flow is unpredictable and cannot be modeled mathematically.

multiple_choice_question.text: In the context of the spatially explicit model with cooperation, what does the parameter µ represent?
choices: The rate at which an agent earns money.
The rate at which an agent spends money.
The rate at which neighboring agents interact and potentially exchange money.
The average amount of money per agent in the system.

multiple_choice_question.text: According to Theorem 1, under what condition is global survival guaranteed in the model with perfect cooperation (µ= ∞)?
choices: When the average earning rate of agents (Φ) is less than 1.
When the initial number of coins per agent (c) is equal to the graph distance (D).
Global survival is never guaranteed, regardless of the values of Φ and c.
When the expression (1 – Φ-(nc-D+1)) is greater than or equal to 1.
